intro: Omphalea mansfeldiana, commonly known as the Mansfeld's omphalea, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
